def.dt: :to cleanse, disentangle, and collect together (as fibers) by the use of cards preparatory to spinning

entry.et: Middle English carde, from Medieval Latin cardus, carduus, thistle, carding instrument, from Latin carduus thistle chard

def.dt: :an instrument or machine for carding fibers that consists usually of bent wire teeth set closely in rows in a thick piece of leather fastened to a back
:an implement for raising a nap on cloth

entry.et: Middle English carde, from Anglo-French, alteration of Middle French carte, probably from Old Italian carta, literally, leaf of paper, from Latin charta leaf of papyrus, from Greek chartēs

def.dt: :playing card

sin.spl: plural but sing or plural in constr

def.dt: :a game played with cards
:card playing
:something (as an advantage) compared to a valuable playing card in one's hand holding all the cards in negotiations
:an issue especially with emotional appeal that is brought into play to achieve a desired end (as winning a political campaign) played the race card
:a usually clownishly amusing person :wag he's such a card
:compass card
:a flat stiff usually small and rectangular piece of material (as paper, cardboard, or plastic) usually bearing information: as
:postcard
:visiting card
:business card
:credit card
:one bearing a picture (as of a baseball player) on one side and usually statistical data on the other
:one on which computer information is stored (as in the form of punched holes or magnetic encoding)
:one bearing electronic circuit components for insertion into a larger electronic device (as a computer)
:program
:a sports program three fights on the card
:a wine list
:menu
:greeting card a birthday card
:inevitable success just wasn't in the cards for her
:to place or fasten on or by means of a card
:to provide with a card
:to list or record on a card
:score a golfer carding a 75
:to ask for identification (as in a bar) we all got carded

entry.et: from the assumption that such a person carries an identification card

def.dt: :being a full-fledged member of an organization (as a Communist party)
:strongly identified with a group (as of people with a common interest) card–carrying members of the ecology movement R. J. Neuhaus
:being such emphatically or unmistakably a card–carrying hippie
:a catalog (as of books) in which the entries are arranged systematically on cards
:a table designed for playing cards
:a square table with folding legs
:a credit card which is issued in affiliation with a participating organization (as a charity or an airline) and the use of which earns a benefit for the organization or the cardholder
:a card (as a credit card or an ATM card) issued by a bank
